result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnny Deon Ashley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Pay mandatory DNA surcharge, all court costs, fees and surcharges.   A payment plan for all monetary obligations to be established by DOC, probation and parole.  All unpaid monetary obligations at the end of probation period will convert to a civil judgment.

No alcohol or drugs.  No possession, consumption, selling, distributing of illegal drugs/alcohol.
No contact with victim Bassan A., Cell World Tobacco.

AODA assessment. Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens if deemed appropriate.  A refusal for screening test will be deemed as a positive test.

timeConds.notes:
The first month to be served.  Huber release privileges for work and school.  Report on 8/15/14.
Remaining five (5) months to be used at the discretion of probation and parole.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Johnny Deon Ashley in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-23-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Johnny Deon Ashley in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Paul Hauer for Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Report dated 4/15/14.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no alcohol.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Johnny Deon Ashley in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Johnny Deon Ashley in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
